column4: I don't know the protocols here but I have a question about monitor resolution.  Version 7.10 correctly detected my 1440x900 monitor but I made a fresh install of 8.04.1 and it gives me a choice either of 640x480 or using 1440x900 in a virtual mode which is still apparently a 640x480 setting.  How do I set it to do real 1440x900?
iit really depends on whether you have the correct driver for your graphics card. default most X servers start using a vga driver if they dont detect your graphics card driver
can you open up a terminal and type sudo apt-get install pastebinit? once this is done type lspci > lspci.txt and cat lspci.txt | pastebinit
missed it mate, you need to address it to me
you need to check whether that s3 driver is the one your X server is using
do this in a terminal sudo apt-get install xserver-xorg-video-s3
you just need to press ctl+alt+backspace to restart the X server
your video driver is loading ok; its your monitor thats not letting  you get into higher resolution
do you remember/can you find out your monitor's horizontal and vertical refresh rates?
sorry, i saw that file; you need to put in the values for your monitor in that Monitor section on line 36
the format for xorg.conf is here --> http://www.x.org/archive/X11R6.8.0/doc/xorg.conf.5.html
